content.headline: HEALTHCARE SAAS STARTUP
content.subheadline: Design complete IAM system para HIPAA compliance

content.headline: Tu Startup: MediSaaS (EHR - Electronic Health Records)
content.body: MediSaaS es SaaS platform para clinics. 10K patients, 200 healthcare providers (doctors, nurses, admins) en 15 clinics. Hosts en AWS (HIPAA-compliant infrastructure). Necesitas diseÃ±ar: 1) IAM architecture (roles, access control), 2) Authentication strategy, 3) HIPAA compliance approach, 4) Incident response plan. Budget: $140K/year.

highlight_box.text: Requirements: HIPAA compliance, multi-tenant isolation, audit logging, MFA, least privilege, breach notification plan.

content.scenario: DiseÃ±as roles para MediSaaS. Healthcare providers necesitan diferentes access levels. Â¿QuÃ© architecture?

options.text: 2 roles: 'Admin' (full access) y 'User' (basic access)

consequence.title: Too Broad
consequence.description: Receptionist NO debe ver prescriptions. Nurse NO debe modify billing. Least privilege violated. HIPAA audit fail. Need granular roles.

options.text: RBAC: Doctor, Nurse, Receptionist, Billing, Admin - scoped permissions

consequence.title: Proper RBAC
consequence.description: Doctor: Read/write clinical notes + prescriptions. Nurse: Read clinical, no prescriptions. Receptionist: Scheduling only. Billing: Financial data only. Least privilege achieved.

options.text: ABAC: Context-based (time, location, patient relationship)

consequence.title: Over-Engineering
consequence.description: ABAC es powerful pero complex y expensive. Para 200 users, RBAC suficiente. ABAC para large enterprises (1000s users). Budget constraint.

content.scenario: Healthcare providers acceden desde clinics (trusted) y desde home (untrusted). Â¿QuÃ© authentication strategy?

options.text: Password only (NIST-compliant: 12+ chars, breach check)

consequence.title: Insufficient para HIPAA
consequence.description: HIPAA requires 'unique user identification' + 'access controls'. Password alone vulnerable a credential stuffing, phishing. HIPAA auditors expect MFA.

options.text: MFA mandatory (TOTP app + SMS backup) + Conditional Access

consequence.title: HIPAA Compliant
consequence.description: MFA blocks 99.9% credential attacks. Conditional Access: Require MFA from untrusted locations. Allow MFA bypass from trusted clinic IPs. Balance security + UX. Cost: $14K/year (Okta MFA).

options.text: Biometric only (fingerprint scanners en all devices)

consequence.title: Budget Overrun
consequence.description: Hardware scanners: $200/device Ã— 250 devices = $50K. Not scalable (BYOD, work from home). Biometric good pero not sole factor. Too expensive.

content.scenario: MediSaaS tiene 15 clinics. Each clinic es separate tenant. Clinic A NO debe ver patients de Clinic B. Â¿CÃ³mo enforce tenant isolation?

options.text: Shared database con tenant_id column, app-level filtering

consequence.title: Risky Approach
consequence.description: SQL injection o app bug â†’ cross-tenant data leak. HIPAA violation = massive fines. Insuficiente isolation. Many SaaS breaches fueron app-level filtering failures.

options.text: Separate database per clinic (RDS instance per tenant)

consequence.title: Strong Isolation pero Budget
consequence.description: Perfect isolation pero expensive. RDS: $50/month Ã— 15 = $750/month = $9K/year (manageable). BUT complexity: 15 databases, backups, migrations. Over-engineering para 15 tenants.

options.text: Database schema per tenant + RLS (Row Level Security)

consequence.title: Optimal Balance
consequence.description: PostgreSQL RLS enforces isolation at DB level (not app). Schemas separate data. Cost-effective (single RDS). Strong security + scalability. Industry standard para SaaS.

content.scenario: HIPAA require audit logs de access a PHI (Protected Health Information). Â¿QuÃ© logging strategy?

options.text: Application logs only (log4j a file, 30-day retention)

consequence.title: HIPAA Non-Compliant
consequence.description: HIPAA require: 6-year retention, tamper-proof, centralized. File logs easy to delete/modify. 30 days insuficiente. Audit fail.

options.text: SIEM (Splunk/ELK) + CloudTrail + 6-year retention + alerting

consequence.title: HIPAA Compliant
consequence.description: SIEM centralized logging. CloudTrail (AWS API audit). 6-year retention. Immutable (S3 Object Lock). Real-time alerts (anomalous access). Cost: $60K/year (within budget). Industry standard.

options.text: Manual Excel spreadsheet de user actions

consequence.title: Completely Inadequate
consequence.description: Manual logs: Not real-time, easy to forge, no automation, scales poorly. HIPAA auditors would laugh. Total failure.

content.scenario: MediSaaS en AWS. Backend EC2 instances necesitan access a S3 (patient documents) y RDS (database). Â¿QuÃ© credential strategy?

options.text: AWS access keys en environment variables

consequence.title: Uber-Style Risk
consequence.description: Keys leakable (logs, GitHub, memory dumps). Permanent credentials. Uber breach: GitHub key â†’ 57M records. Capital One: SSRF + keys â†’ 100M records. Never use keys para EC2.

options.text: IAM roles (EC2 instance profile) + scoped permissions

consequence.title: AWS Best Practice
consequence.description: IAM role: Temporary credentials (auto-rotate), no storage, cannot leak long-term. Scoped: s3:GetObject/PutObject en patient-docs bucket, RDS connect only. Least privilege. Industry standard.

options.text: Root account credentials (full control)

consequence.title: Catastrophic
consequence.description: Root = god mode, unrestricted. If leaked: Account closure, data deletion, total control. Never use root para app access. Lock root away.

content.scenario: 3AM alert: Suspicious logins from Russia. 5 patient records accessed. Investigation confirms: Compromised doctor credentials (phishing). Â¿QuÃ© haces PRIMERO?

options.text: Investigate fully (1 week) antes de notificar

consequence.title: HIPAA Violation
consequence.description: HIPAA Breach Notification Rule: 60 days to notify HHS + affected individuals. Waiting 1 week OK, BUT must start notification process. Uber mistake: 1-year cover-up = criminal charges.

options.text: 1) Revoke credentials 2) Isolate systems 3) Preserve evidence 4) Notify legal/compliance

consequence.title: Proper Incident Response
consequence.description: Contain first (stop bleeding), preserve forensics (legal holds), notify legal (breach notification timeline). HHS notification: 60 days if <500 patients. Transparency protects company long-term.

options.text: Contact attacker, pagar para no leak data

consequence.title: Cover-Up = Federal Crime
consequence.description: Uber CISO: Paid $100K, convicted obstruction of justice + misprision. 3 years probation. Cover-up worse than breach. Always report.

categories.name: PAM Tool (CyberArk Lite)
categories.impact: JIT admin access, session recording, vault

categories.name: Security Awareness Training
categories.impact: Reduce human error (80% breaches involve people)

content.explanation: Optimal: SSO + MFA + SIEM (mandatory: $93K) + Security Training ($8K) + Pentest ($22K) = $123K. Leaves $17K buffer. PAM nice-to-have pero 10 admins manageable sin it. DLP expensive y limited ROI para small team.

content.question: Para MediSaaS (200 users), Â¿por quÃ© RBAC es mejor choice que ABAC?

options.text: RBAC es mÃ¡s seguro que ABAC
RBAC sufficient granularity para 200 users, ABAC over-engineering + expensive
ABAC no funciona en healthcare

content.explanation: RBAC: 5-10 roles (Doctor, Nurse, etc), aligns con org structure, cost-effective. ABAC: Complex attribute policies, scales mejor para 1000s users, expensive infrastructure. Para 200 users, RBAC sufficient.

content.question: Â¿Por quÃ© database schema per tenant + RLS es mejor que shared DB con tenant_id?

options.text: Schemas son mÃ¡s rÃ¡pidos
RLS enforces isolation at DB level (not app), protege contra app bugs/SQL injection
Tenant_id column es HIPAA non-compliant

content.explanation: App-level filtering (tenant_id WHERE clause): Vulnerable a app bugs, SQL injection. RLS (Row Level Security): Database enforces, even si app compromised. Schema separation + RLS = defense in depth.

content.question: Â¿Por quÃ© IAM roles son critical para MediSaaS EC2 instances?

options.text: Roles dan mÃ¡s permissions que access keys
Roles = temporary credentials (auto-rotate), keys = permanent (leakable)
HIPAA require roles, not keys

content.explanation: IAM roles: Temporary (1-12h), auto-rotate, cannot leak long-term, no storage. Keys: Permanent, stored en config, GitHub leaks common (Uber, Capital One). Always roles para AWS services.

content.question: MediSaaS breach: 5 patients affected. Â¿Notification timeline?

options.text: No notification necesaria (<500 patients threshold)
Notify HHS + affected individuals dentro de 60 dÃ­as
Notify solo si >1,000 patients affected

content.explanation: HIPAA Breach Notification: ANY breach de unsecured PHI require notification. <500 patients: 60 days to notify HHS + individuals. â‰¥500: Notify HHS + media within 60 days. No threshold exemption.

content.question: Â¿Por quÃ© MFA es mandatory para MediSaaS (HIPAA)?

options.text: HIPAA explicitly require MFA en regulation text
HIPAA require 'access controls' - auditors expect MFA como reasonable safeguard
MFA solo needed para admin accounts

content.explanation: HIPAA NO explicitly mandate MFA, BUT require 'implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information systems [...] to allow access only to authorized persons' (Â§164.312(a)(1)). Auditors consider MFA industry standard = reasonably expected.

content.scenario: MediSaaS SIEM logs. Find las 3 lines que indican unauthorized PHI access.

log_lines.reason: Doctor de Clinic 2 accediendo patient de Clinic 1 = cross-tenant access violation

log_lines.reason: External email + suspicious IP (Tor) = compromised credentials o breach
Mass export (1500 records) por billing staff = potential data exfiltration

achievement.name: IAM Master Architect
achievement.description: Completed comprehensive IAM system design para healthcare SaaS

key_takeaways: RBAC Design: Granular roles (Doctor, Nurse, Receptionist) con scoped permissions
Authentication: MFA mandatory + Conditional Access para HIPAA compliance
Multi-Tenancy: Database schema per tenant + RLS (Row-Level Security)
Audit Logging: SIEM + CloudTrail, 6-year retention, immutable
Cloud IAM: IAM roles > access keys. Least privilege. No root usage.
Breach Response: Contain, preserve evidence, notify legal, HHS within 60 days
Budget: SSO ($19K) + MFA ($14K) + SIEM ($60K) + Training ($8K) + Pentest ($22K) = $123K
